1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
something to sieze with, i.e. a finger; by analogy, a toe
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

2.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
to tread in pieces, i.e. (figuratively) to conquer, or (specifically) to overlay
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a man in general (singly or collectively)

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

4.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

5.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to smoke, whether literal or figurative

6.brief: lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
properly, to put in commotion; by implication, to disturb, drive, destroy

7.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
to rend, i.e. open (especially the mouth)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
foreign, or (concretely) a foreigner, or (abstractly) heathendom

8.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

9.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
ten; by abbreviated form ten strings, and so a decachord
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)
to rend, i.e. open (especially the mouth)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

structure; by implication, a model, resemblance

properly, nourished (or fully developed), i.e. a form or sort
near, with or among; often in general, to

a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
properly, to cast together , i.e. increase, especially in number; to multiply by the myriad
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors

to carry (literally or figuratively), or (reflexively) be burdensome; specifically, to be gravid
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
